repo.name: logdy-core
repo.description: Realtime log viewer with web UI, tail -f for logs with a web interface browser.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and quick start with multiple installation methods, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and has incomplete configuration documentation.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common issues (connection problems, port conflicts, file permissions, etc.)

injection_risks.description: The `strconv.Atoi` function is used to convert user input to an integer, but it does not handle errors properly. If the input cannot be converted to an integer, it will panic.
The `os/exec` package is used to execute a command with user-provided arguments, but it does not properly escape the arguments. This could lead to command injection vulnerabilities.

critical_findings: Command injection vulnerability in the `os/exec` package.
Potential exposure of sensitive information through error messages.
security.summary: The Logdy application has several security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities, lack of input validation, and potential exposure of sensitive information.

common_complaints: Missing UI/UX features (colors, JSON formatting, column width control)
Configuration limitations (per-file configs, subpath support, title customization)
Log management issues (clearing old logs, following directories)
Docker deployment gaps (missing Dockerfile, port exposure)
Performance/stability concerns (stale logs persisting after hours)
praise_themes: Tool functionality is appreciated when working
Core log viewing capability is solid
sentiment.summary: Community health is declining with accumulating feature requests going unaddressed for 3+ months, several resolved-but-not-merged issues, minimal maintainer engagement, and concerning unresolved stability bugs.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth and encourage new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months (last commit was August 2025, over 4 months ago)
31 open issues with no recent activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: The logdy project appears abandoned with no development activity, issue resolution, or contributor engagement in the past 6 months despite a growing backlog of open issues.

project_metrics.description: Realtime log viewer with web UI, tail -f for logs with a web interface browser.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides good installation instructions, but could benefit from more examples and better troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Low number of commits in the past six months (only 1)
No merged PRs in the past six months
Docs: Lack of comprehensive troubleshooting section
Community: feature requests not addressed promptly
Security: Command injection vulnerability in the `os/exec` package.
Security: Potential exposure of sensitive information through error messages.
Security: The `strconv.Atoi` function is used to convert user input to an integer, but it does not handle errors properly. If the input cannot be converted to an integer, it will panic.
highlights: Recent open issues and PRs indicate some level of community interest
A recent release within the last year
